list-item.p: Influenza virus affects the respiratory tract by direct viral infection or by damage from the immune system response.
Approximately 30â€“40% of hospitalized patients with laboratory-confirmed influenza are diagnosed with acute pneumonia.
Coinfections with other viruses and bacteria are common.
Influenza should be suspected not only in patients with typical symptoms and epidemiology, but also in patients with severe pneumonia, ARDS, sepsis, encephalitis, myocarditis, and rhabdomyolysis.
